data.title: Great cafe!!
data.text: Worth a visit! I had lunch with a friend who was familiar with the cafe! So glad she suggested this hidden gem! I had Tuscan chicken sandwich which was very tasty, great sandwich and friend had sweet potato wrap; she loved it! I also had chicken salad to go since it was highly recommended!! Family had it for lunch next day and it was really good! Had oranges, pecans and cran-raisins!  Definitely recommend and I will be back!!

data.title: Great place for lunch in Concord
data.text: We were visiting Concord for two days, and a local woman suggested we go here for lunch. Loved the food and the staff. Had chicken salad and avocado one day and the tuscan chicken the next day. Delicious. Soups were also very good. The prices are very reasonable. You can get a Senior half sandwich and soup for $5. Highly recommend Carm's Cafe.

data.title: Delicious little cafe
data.text:
We had an amazing lunch served by three great staff members. The chicken salad was DELICIOUS. Although they didn't have the side-salad with the quinoa available, I did get to substitute an equally delicious small greens salad with REALLY good balsamic dressing.

The service was excellent.

data.title: Wonderful, as always
data.text: Concord surprised me. A small Southern town, north of Charlotte should not have this many great places to eat. Bistro, Gianni's are great for dinner, Carm's is our go to place for lunch. All great

data.title: Best Chicken Salad Around
data.text: Carm's is a great sandwich shop!  Dana makes everything from scratch.  We particularly enjoy the chicken salad, avacado chicken salad, and pimento cheese.  She has soup specials daily and the occasional low-country boil.  One of the best restaurants in downtown Concord.

data.title: My New Favorite!
data.text: I went for lunch today and absolutely loved my food!  I got a chicken salad on a tomato basil wrap with a side of macaroni salad.  I can't see where either needs one ounce of improvement.  I definitely recommend this place and I will be going back!

data.title: A very nice place to eat
data.text: I have eaten here a lot more than once and have always enjoyed her food. The owner does a great job in making sure she serves the very best.  they have good soups and salads as well as sandwiches.

data.title: What a wonderful surprise
data.text:
We are sick of the chain restaurants, same industrial food, with no real taste or flavor. However, many independent restaurants are not much better, just different ways to prepare grease.

Then you find a gem like Carm's. Everything is homemade and delicious. They have a soup of the day- today it was chicken pot pie- and it was wonderful. Seasoned just right. I had a wrap that was excellent.

Not expensive, great service and great food- a trifecta for sure

data.title: Poor Customer Service
data.text:
Carm's was recommended to me by several people. I was looking for a cheese cake for a party I was hosting. I called and was able to obtain the information I needed, and then I followed up with a visit and ordered the cheesecake. (Their cheesecake is 12 pieces, and I was able to get a variety all packaged separately). They told me it would be ready to pick up on Saturday after 12 noon. 

My husband and I went to pick it up and decided to try them for lunch. They were busy, and obviously understaffed because the service was severely lacking. We ordered a sandwich/soup combo, and a salad/soup combo. The sandwich was skimpy, both cups of soup were barely lukewarm. the shrimp & grits had fantastic flavor and would  have been sheer delight it it had been hot. The salad was good.

After lunch we went to the counter to pay and to pick up the cheesecake slices, WHICH WEREN'T READY! Dana asked us to come back in an hour (a HUGE inconvenience) and rather than apologize for the inconvenience she gave a whole list of excuses. We came back and hour later, and THEY STILL WEREN'T READY and we had to stand there and wait for another 20 minutes!!!
She gave more excuses, never apologized and offered no concession. If I didn't need the cheesecake for the party I would have walked out. 

I understand having a busy day, and that things do happen, but making excuses rather apologizing and offering some sort of concession for the inconvenience is very poor customer service indeed. A simple heartfelt apology would have gone a long way.

data.title: Great stop for a sandwich/salad and quick drink
data.text: Great selection of sandwiches, quick, clean, and delicious. Dana takes pride in preparing good healthy sandwiches. Great selection of salads too. outstanding customer service. Reasonably priced but portions are a bit small.. Closes early, typically by 4 PM

data.title: Unique
data.text: With all the special dietary restrictions allergies these days, it's hard to find a place that caters to all your needs. Well look no further! Not only is this place really yummy and unique, they are also very accommodating!! Support local business and try this place out!

data.title: Quick lunch
data.text: Outstanding! Forget the boring humdrum burgers. If want something flavorful, homade, affordable and served on a real plate in a casual enviroment, come here. These people put a lot of thought in their recipies.  Who would have thought that a chicken sandwich with a side of pasta salad would be a symphony of flavors. Well done ladies, thank you!

data.title: Healthy, fresh and tasty food!
data.text: Hands down the best Shrimp n' Grits that I have ever eaten. Vegetarian and gluten free menu options. Fresh bakery treats. Unpretentious...good food and service!

data.title: Friday is shrimp and grits day
data.text: While Carm's is very good everyday, Friday is their shrimp and grits day. I am not a huge S&G guy but Carm does to to perfection. Recommend the half sandwich, any one of them, and you get a cup of S&G.

data.title: Dinner out with friends
data.text: Carm's is normally a breakfast and lunch sort of place. Every so often they have a dinner activity and a special menu. Tonight we had "2 Buckets of Crab Legs, Sausage, potatoes, corn on the cob & carrots" (A  Southern Boil) with friends. What fun!  Friendly staff. We ate with our fingers and left shells and all on brown paper table cloths. We BYOB and thoroughly enjoyed an evening with friends.

data.title: Delicious
data.text: Had a delicious Caesar chicken wrap. Great, friendly, service. So much to offer with several options. Nice little cafe. Definitely stop in.

data.title: Nice Little Cafe
data.text: We stopped in for a drink and each had a green smoothie that were very good. There were plenty of options for lunch or a snack, and a variety of different flavored lattes to choose from. It was very clean and the people were very friendly and helpful.

data.title: Great Little Place
data.text: Try the soup... or the California Cuban... or just about anything! Home-made-and-concocted goodness served with a smile and a price you'll welcome. We'd passed by Carm's a number of times, and when we finally did stop in for lunch we kicked ourselves for all those times. The place is small, nicely decorated, but nothing out of the ordinary. The food and service is very much out of the ordinary. We plan to go back for breakfast (served until Noon). That menu looks great too. If you're in downtown Concord, don't pass Carm's by!

data.title: Yummy!!
data.text: Got this little gem off of Trip Advisor...avocado chicken salad was great and their shrimp bisque was yummy!  Nice little find :)
This place has really good sandwhichs. The only problem is it's kind of high for a sandwhich. $7 for that is too much. I used an attraction book and got 2 meals for $7!
